channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 The New York Times Company

item.title: Terrorism Raids in Belgium Yield 16 Arrests
item.description: The authorities in Brussels announced that 16 people had been arrested in an operation, though they said Salah Abdeslam was not among those arrested.
item.dc:creator: ANDREW HIGGINS and KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA
item.media:description: A Belgian soldier stood guard at the Grand Place Central Square in Brussels on Sunday.

item.title: Panels Advise Bolstering W.H.O. for Crises Like Ebola
item.description: Both groups said that the United Nations health agency’s outbreak and emergency response capacities should be strengthened, and protected from political meddling.
item.dc:creator: SHERI FINK

item.title: In Rebuke to Kirchner, Argentines Elect Opposition Leader Mauricio Macri as President
item.description: Mauricio Macri, 56, stunned the political establishment in October by forcing the race into a runoff and maintaining his surge in recent weeks.
item.dc:creator: SIMON ROMERO and JONATHAN GILBERT
item.media:description: Supporters of the presidential candidate Mauricio Macri cheered in Buenos Aires on Sunday.

item.title: Defiance and Necessity Spur Mali Back to Normal After Attack
item.description: Most in Bamako returned to their normal lives after the terrorist attack on a hotel despite little evidence of increased security.
item.dc:creator: DIONNE SEARCEY
item.media:description: Outside the Radisson Blu hotel in Bamako, Mali on Saturday.

item.title: Landslide Near Jade Mine in Myanmar Kills About 100
item.description: The landslide occurred in the Kachin State area of Hpakant, where 100 to 200 people were still missing, according to a community leader.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
item.media:description: Rescuers in Hpakant, Myanmar, on Sunday laid out the bodies of those killed in a landslide near a mine the day before.

item.title: Saudi Artist’s Death Sentence Follows a String of Harsh Punishments
item.description: The case of Ashraf Fayadh, who was sentenced to death on charges of apostasy, is one of several that have fueled comparisons between Saudi Arabia and the jihadists of the Islamic State.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: BEN HUBBARD

item.title: Hong Kong Journal: Towering, Teeming Hong Kong — Where the Buffalo Roam
item.description: Most of Hong Kong is not an urban jungle, but rather a real one, bristling with monkeys, pythons and boars — and a lot of feral cattle.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL FORSYTHE
item.media:credit: Lam Yik Fei for The New York Times
item.media:description: A cow on a Hong Kong street last week. As many as 1,000-odd feral bovines, as well as monkeys, pythons and other animals, live in the city.

item.title: White House Letter: On Foreign Trip, Obama Yet Again Contends With Events Elsewhere
item.description: The president has been dealing with the attacks in Paris and Mali while visiting Asia, another in a series of travels in which events have disrupted his planned message.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL D. SHEAR

item.title: Saeed Jaffrey, Actor in ‘Gandhi’ and ‘The Man Who Would Be King,’ Dies at 86
item.description: Mr. Jaffrey, best known in his native India for roles he characterized as “the naughty uncle,” had a career in radio, film, TV and onstage encompassing three continents.
item.category: The Man Who Would Be King (Movie)
item.dc:creator: NIDA NAJAR
item.media:description: Gordon Warnecke, Shirley Anne Field and Saeed Jaffrey in “My Beautiful Laundrette.”

item.title: Bahrain Abuses Continues Despite King’s Pledge, Rights Group Says
item.description: Human Rights Watch released a report saying it had interviewed 10 detainees who described torture and other practices that King Hamad bin Isa al-Khalifa promised to end four years ago.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: KAREEM FAHIM

item.title: Nepal Police Kill 3 Protesters in Clashes Over Constitution
item.description: Violence flared in southern Nepal when the police opened fire on protesters from the Madhesi group who had been blocking the country’s main highway.
item.dc:creator: BHADRA SHARMA

item.title: Jason Rezaian of Washington Post Said to Be Sentenced to Prison
item.description: The announcement from the Iranian judiciary, reported by a news agency in Iran, contained no information about the length of his prison term.
item.dc:creator: PENN BULLOCK

item.title: Paris Attacks and Other Assaults Seen as Evidence of a Shift by ISIS
item.description: Attacks carried out far from the Islamic State’s base in Iraq and Syria upend the view held by the United States and its allies that the group was a regional threat.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ERIC SCHMITT
item.media:credit: Pierre Terdjman for The New York Times
item.media:description: A restaurant this weekend in Paris, not far from a scene of the terrorist attacks of the previous week.

item.title: Crimea in Dark After Power Lines Are Blown Up
item.description: Russian news reports said saboteurs were responsible for shutting down the lines in the disputed peninsula.
item.dc:creator: NEIL MacFARQUHAR
item.media:description: A man looked at electricity supply meters on Sunday at a house in Simferopol in the Russian-annexed peninsula of Crimea.

item.title: Sinosphere: Q. and A.: Jindong Cai on ‘Beethoven in China’
item.description: During a visit to his native Beijing, Mr. Cai discussed classical music, Beethoven’s popularity and why there are so many new concert halls in China.
item.dc:creator: IAN JOHNSON
item.media:description: Jindong Cai conducting the Stanford Symphony Orchestra during its China tour in 2008.

item.title: Israeli Woman and 3 Palestinian Attackers Killed in West Bank
item.description: An Israeli woman was stabbed to death in Etzion block as violence flared with three Palestinians carrying out separate attacks in the occupied West Bank.
item.dc:creator: JODI RUDOREN

item.title: Heng: Cartoon: Heng on the Asia Pacific Summit
item.description: President Obama has called on China to halt its construction on reclaimed islands in the South China Sea.

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: What the Mali Attack Means
item.description: From Nairobi to Paris to Bamako, armed assaults on civilian targets have become the jihadists' signature attack.
item.dc:creator: JOE PENNEY

item.title: Obama Orders Inquiry Into Intelligence on ISIS
item.description: The president was responding to a New York Times report on a Pentagon investigation into whether intelligence reports overstated military progress against the Islamic State.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL D. SHEAR
item.media:description: "I don't want intelligence shaded by politics," President Obama said in Malaysia on Sunday as he concluded an overseas trip.

item.title: Pentagon Expands Inquiry Into Intelligence on ISIS Surge
item.description: The Pentagon has seized a trove of emails and documents as it widens an investigation into Central Command over accusations that officials had overstated the progress of airstrikes against the Islamic State.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: MATT APUZZO, MARK MAZZETTI and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT
item.media:description: Iraqi gear littered the ground near an Iraqi Army checkpoint east of Mosul on June 11, 2014, a day after militants overran the city.
